I agree with everything except: {{item:3146}} is not situational for LB and {{item:3100}} isnt even good on Fizz anymore imo, its just good for split pushing which he is forced to do. 

And 35% total/bonus pen doesnt make defense irrelevant

What are you talking about, Lich Bane is core for Fizz. He procs it easily with his Q and Lich Bane + his W = insane burst. It is just not good as a first item, Hextech Protobelt is a better first item now.

It ofc doesn't make defences completely irrelevant, but he has a point that it hurts the viability of tanks/juggernauts that (almost) exclusively rely on items for their defences, Tank-items aren't that amazingly cost efficient to start with, and losing 35/40% of the MR/Armour value, because the enemy bought an item, really stings.

Just look at the tanks being played at worlds. All of them have extra defences in their kits, if they didn't they would just melt as fast as everything ells would. A Naut or Zac would roughly bring the same value as Sej/gragas do, but as they don't have any extra defences in their kit, they are just to squishy for this meta. While % penetration is ofc not the main reason (Hyper-carries/Ardent being broken is that), it amplifies it by making tank items even less value for their bucks.

I don't think removing them is the solution though; you still need a way to kill tanks, but the commitment should be more then 'buy' this item. One idea I had myself is making Last Whisper not work with crits. Would mean you had to go for a non-crit build if you wanted to be a true tank killer, losing damage against non-tanks (On hit builds will be a problem, but meh it was just an idea)
Every tank has extra defense tho, thats what tanks do.

Not the same.

Zac doesn't have extra defense.

Whereas Sej has the massive spike at the start of a fight, and Gragas has % dmg reduction on his W.

THAT is what he means by extra defense.

I'd consider anything that boosts your effective HP (IE Zac passive respawn and healing) as extra defense personally.

Anything that increases your survival and stacks with defensive stats really is what encourages someone to be a tank rather than a damage dealer.

Exception until SV, the sustain is not significant for fights, its purely for sustaining himself through the jungle.

And after SV, he is putting himself in MORE danger to collect the blobs to heal, there are good odds walking to a blob to heal will result in him taking more damage than he will heal, therefore the end result is basically 0.

As for the passive, that is hardly extra defense. That is something separate entirely.

Notice the strong/popular tanks in the meta have % dmg reduction, or MASSIVE protection (sej passive), whereas garbage like Naut's "shield" (which barely makes him tanky) are basically irrelevant.

Nautilus has a huge shield and Zac has his passive. They may not be defenses with your definition but they most certainly help their defensive capabilities.

 Also Nautilus was played at Worlds. The reason that Sej and Gragas are dominant is because they are overtuned and they have rather broken kits (highly mobiles tanks are cancer)
Nautilus's shield is big in theory but he doesnt get the gold (on supp or jg) to get enough HP items.

As a LeBlanc main, I’ll tell you that Gunblade is NOT situational at all.
Yes, you can get protobelt for less gold (without wasting gold on AD and lifesteal) but without the reliability that GB offers and the omnivamp good luck dueling someone with her bullshit delays.

I’ve played Ahri as well this season and after her last nerf I feel like she needs some help to burst someone 1v1, either a revolver item or a lich bane (or both).

We’re at a point where some AP champions need 300 damage from items to succeed as burst mages/assassins, and this shit happens because AP itemization itself compared to AD+Support itemization is garbage. 

Also, I don’t agree with Guise and Doran’s ring current state. Sure, Guise is super strong considering that it’s the only AP item that gives flat MPen with sorcs, but MPen is disgustingly expensive compared to MR. Also, Guise starts as a squishy-bursting item and builds into an item supposed to do... well I don’t know, it gives flat MPen (supposed to work vs squishies) and a %current health damage that suggests to build it against tanks, so it definitely needs more building options or a rework. 

As for Doran’s ring, I think that the last nerf (after tanks abused the mana refund passive) was bigger than everyone thinks.
Some champions like Morgana used to build more rings to survive laning phase/have a chance to push without going oom before chapter, and now the mana refund is a joke and if you’re behind you’re forced to sit on Doran+dark seal for ages. It would be cool if it gave double the mana (8, not much) for cannons/takedowns or every X units killed.

Yeah, it's kind of cornerstone to the entire Magic Damage system and why it's fairly toxic right now.

Void Staff is the crutch damage ramp item for mages, because almost literally every other AP item has been gutted.

Since Void Staff is *the* standard damage item you buy even if the enemy team has no MR, MR is heavily devalued.

Since MR is heavily devalued, MR items need to be absurdly strong, since 35%(soon to be 40%) of their MR is *baseline defunct*.

Since MR items are now inflated, the other AP items feel *significantly* worse.

Nashor's Tooth is one of the most gold efficient items in the game. It's not a mage item either; it's a specialized item.

Hourglass is still the most bought AP item. Give it like 5 AP or something and reduce the active's cooldown.

Lost Chapter and Morello need a nerf. Revert Catalyst to make RoA and GLP viable options. Make Rylais not a support item. Lower prices on Ludens and Deathcap. Hextech GLP is amazing on Zilean and has multiple synergies with his kit specifically, but remains very underpurchased (likely due to Zilean mid's status as a counterpick in high elo, resulting in people not theorycrafting with him like they do with meta picks).

It sets up AOE double bomb stun
It allows TLD to be procced without an auto
It gives Zilean, who only has one damaging ability, an extra AP ratio and base damage

Similar case for the item on TF - he has low AP ratios in his kit, and the active helps him buy enough tike to lock in and throw out a gold card.

I also think this item has a case on Veigar due to an extra AP ratio being so meaningful, helping to land E stun, and allowing for low counterplay Hextech->Q->ult oneshots without needing to land W. Similar to Zilean, Veigar isnt really seen as a serious meta  mid pick (though that kinda changed recently) and so the high elo players dont really put effort into their itemization cause in their mind, they're already kinda trolling by playing Veigar. 

That being said, Veigar needs CDR pretty badly and GLP makes it awkward, so I don't advocate it as strongly as I do for Zilean. But, the fact remains that the item is underpurchased, if only in comparison to RoA.

Mages have good items. Luden's Echo gives quite a lot of damage, the only time people complain about it is when they compare the damage directly to Stattik Shiv. Ignoring the fact that Stattik doesn't even give AD and Luden's gives 100 AP, you shouldn't be comparing items across classes. Mages have very different goals compared to marksmen. Mages want to deal damage to the entire enemy team, marksmen want to kill one person while they drain tank off that person. Mages have range, they have more durability, and they have better CC. The large majority of ADC CC is "AH! Get off of me!" Mage CC is better for catching someone out and blowing them up from a safe distance. (Veigar can easily Burst someone down without ever entering auto range).
